授業方法: All lectures are conducted completely face-to-face. Class discussion of selected readings will be complemented by both in-class tasks and out-of-class writing assignments. Students will work both individually and in small groups to complete writing assignments. The actual number and type of different writing assignments students complete will depend on students' previous experience composing business documents in English.

第1回: Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第2回:
Effective Email Practices.
Pre-class study: Reflect on what you think is important in writing for business (1 hour).
Post-class study: Analyze your first attempt at writing in class. Contribute to an online forum with your opinion on writing skills (3 hours).
Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第3回: Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第4回:
Resumes and Cover Letters.
Pre-class study: Vocabulary related to writing skills. Register with an online learning tool (1 hour).
Post-class study: Correct and resubmit via an online file storage service your attempt at an in-class writing task (3 hours).
Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第5回: Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第6回:
Memorandums.
Pre-class study: Preview for a lengthy article on negotiation skills by testing your vocabulary knowledge through an online vocabulary learning tool (1 hour).
Post-class study: Review of in-class writing tasks. Additional article to read and submit opinions via an online writing forum (3 hours).
Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第7回: Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第8回:
Writing a summary.
Pre-class study: Preparation for an in-class writing workshop task (1 hour).
Post-class study: Follow-up to an in-class activity involving the partial construction of an in-class writing guide (3 hours).
Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第9回: Further work on writing a summary.
Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第10回:
Pre-class study: Grammar task preparation (1 hour).
Post-class study: Peer correction. Analyzing a number of classmates' writing tasks (3 hours).
Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第11回: Writing a bad news letter.
Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第12回:
Pre-class study: Research examples online of bad-news letters (1 hour).
Post-class study: Review of resume writing and submission via an online forum of opinions on article read in class (3 hours).
Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第13回: Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
第14回:
Review of writing guides completed to date (1 hour).
Post-class study: Portfolio revisions for final submission (3 hours).
Reading and research about business writing. Tasks related to class materials. At least 3 hours.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students will do most of their writing outside of class. Because writing is a time consuming process, students should plan to spend several hours each week outside of class preparing their documents/assignments. All writing will be completed and submitted electronically.

教科書/Required texts1: There is no set text for this course. Students will be provided with a set of writing assignments based on readings and other multi-media sources that will be used to guide students' writing.
